acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from King and Queen County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: King and Queen County was named for William III and Mary II, who were called to the English throne in 1688. It was formed from New Kent County in 1691.
King and Queen County court records were lost in courthouse fires in 1828 and 1833. Records were destroyed by a courthouse fire set by Union Troups on 10 March 1864 during the Civil War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: King and Queen County (Va.) Surveyor of Roads' Record Book, 1851-1870 contains records giving information about the control, construction, alteration, and maintenance of the roads and bridges in King and Queen County.
